title: Provisions Act 2021 (No. 4 of 2021)) of the Judicial Council Act 2019 (No. 33
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as 

the Judicial Council Act 2019 

(Commencement) Order 2021.
text_norm: 1 order may cited judicial council act 2019 (commencement) order 2021

title: Provisions Act 2021 (No. 4 of 2021)) of the Judicial Council Act 2019 (No. 33
heading: 2. The 24th day of April 2021 is appointed as the day on which sections 98
text_raw:
2. The 24th day of April 2021 is appointed as the day on which sections 98 
and 99 (as amended by section 30 of the Family Leave and Miscellaneous 
Provisions Act 2021 (No. 4 of 2021)) of the Judicial Council Act 2019 (No. 33 
of 2019) shall come into operation. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

15 April, 2021. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 20th April, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [182] 3

title: Provisions Act 2021 (No. 4 of 2021)) of the Judicial Council Act 2019 (No. 33
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order appoints 24 April 2021 as the day on which section 98 and section 
99 (as amended by section 30 of the Family Leave and Miscellaneous Provisions 
Act 2021 (No. 4 of 2021)) of the Judicial Council Act 2019 (No. 33 of 2019) 
come into operation. Sections 98 and 99 of the 2019 Act deal with amendments 
to the Personal Injuries Assessment Board Act 2003 (No. 46 of 2003) and to the 
Civil Liability and Courts Act 2004 (No. 31 of 2004) to make provision in 
relation to the operation of personal injuries guidelines adopted by the Judicial 
Council and related matters. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [182]
